title.narrative: Enhancing Protective Environment for Conflict Affected IDPs in Fafan, Siti, Afder Zones of Somali Region

description.narrative:
Due to technical challenges on GMS, although submitted under GBV, the proposed project covers 90% general protection and 10% GBV.
Somali Region continues to host one of the largest IDP populations in the country, with many who have faced multiple waves of displacement or remain in protracted displacement. Throughout 2021, conflict reignited along the Somali-Afar and the Somali-Oromia regional borders, resulting in new waves of displacement, largely along ethnic lines. According to DTM round 27, there are an estimated 871,176 IDPs (142,671 households) identified in Somali region across 427 sites. Round 27 saw an increase of 36,453 IDPs from round 27, largely due to conflict along regional borders. .
Protection risks are rife in displacement areas, particularly for those facing secondary or repeated cycles of displacement. According to protection monitoring and recent assessments, the population has faced rights violations before, during, and after displacement, as well as the loss of household items and livelihoods opportunities, further exacerbating limited coping capacities. Many households have expressed high rates of trauma due to the violations they experienced in their areas of origin. Combined with the repeated patterns of displacement, many of the displaced people have expressed their intention not to return to their areas of origin, thus heightening the need for durable solutions and social cohesion efforts to be integrated into the protection response.
Through the proposed intervention, DRC seeks to combine its strengths, capacities, and presence to implement a project aimed at providing protection assistance for IDPs displaced due to conflict. The proposed intervention will build upon DRC’s existing programming in Fafan zone, extending protection monitoring, information dissemination, and protection response through IPA, PSS, and provision of information or referrals to access key rights, including civil documentation. The project will be implemented through direct intervention by the DRC Somali team, with offices in Jijiga, Dire Dawa, and Dollo Ado, with all necessary support and close follow-up, supervision, and guidance from Addis Ababa country office and EAGL regional office.
